requestAddRejected: <@{{user}}>'s request to join {{channel}} has been rejected by <@{{approved}}>.
requestAddRejectedDM: Your request to access the channel for {{channel}} has been rejected. Please check the spelling of the project name and if you have followed all of the PM's instructions upon assignment. Otherwise, you can contact our admins through the **/suggest other** command.
channelCreatedWOAdd: A channel for <#{{createdChannel}}> has been created!

yes: Yes. There is a channel called <#{{foundChannel}}>. Would you like to be added to it?
no: No. Would you like me to create that channel for you?

addMePrompt: Do you confirm that you work on {{projectName}} and want to be added to the channel? If this was a mistake, simply dismiss this message.
addMePromptEmpty: You haven't entered a project name.

message:

{{context}}
messageTemplate:
<@{{user}}> wanted to let you know that they've just submitted the template QC for the following project:
 
{{context}}

help: !remindme Name of the event | 01 Jan 2022 20:20 GMT or UTC+3 etc. | How long before the event do you want to be reminded (In minutes) (Ex. 20) | #TargetChannel #OptionalSecondChannel
notADate:
That is not a date. Please try again using the following format:
 
!remindme Name of the event | 01 Jan 2022 20:20 GMT or UTC+3 etc. | How long before the event do you want to be reminded (in minutes) (Ex. 20)? | #TargetChannel #OptionalSecondChannel .
notAnInt: Please enter an integer. I am cancelling your request.
enteredPastDate: I wish I could travel back in time, but I'm not quite there yet. Please enter a date in the future.
Please enter a date in the future. My Tardis is in the shop.
Do I look like a DeLorean? Please enter a date in the future.
Please enter a date in the future. I have run out of Pym Particles.
Even though I am a robot, I have no ties to Skynet. Please enter a date in the future.
Our adventure through time has taken a most serious turn. Please enter a date in the future, and be excellent to each other.
initiated: There's a new event coming up called '{{event}}'. It's going to take place on {{time}}. You'll be reminded in this channel {{before}} minute(s) before the event. See you then! ‚åõ

request: <@{{user}}> has set {{nickName}} as their full name and <@&{{role}}> as their target language.
accepted: <@{{user}}> has been approved as {{nickName}}, a <@&{{role}}> linguist.
acceptedDM: Your server profile has been set up. Your name is {{nickName}} and your target language is {{role}}.
waitForApproveDM: I've received your request to set up your server profile as {{nickName}} and a {{role}} linguist, and sent it to our admins. Please wait for approval. If you made a typo, you can always change your name using the **/nick** command later on.
error: I encountered an issue changing your nickname. It's probably due to the name you entered being more than 32 characters. Either type in a name which has less than 32 characters (we know you're good at condensing, you're a subtitler!) or use the **/suggest other** command if the issue persists.
rejectedDM:
Hi, <@{{user}}>!
 
It seems like one of the details you have entered when setting up your user profile is incorrect. Please go back to the <#{{reception}}> channel and try **/usersetup** again.
rejected: <@{{user}}> has been rejected as {{nickName}}, and a <@&{{role}}> linguist.
setup.afterApproval:
Hello again!
 
This is Sassy, your friendly bot. ü§ñ 
 
You now have access to the server! ü•≥
 
Please feel free to browse; <#{{discord101}}> is a good channel to start from if you're completely new to Discord. If you're already familiar with Discord, maybe we could interest you in the <#{{channelindex}}> channel to see which channel is used for what, or you could check one of our linguists' reading speed manifesto in the <#{{readingspeed}}> channel, and read previous LM-Plint meeting recaps in the <#{{lmmeetingrecaps}}> channel.
 
Also, I come with a bunch of commands to help everyone make the best out of the server!
 
Try /funfact command to learn a random fun fact about the server or its members.
 
Reach out to other subtitlers who speak a certain language for assistance by using the /available command and selecting the language you need.
 
If you're working on a project and want to collaborate with other people working on the same project, you can use /buddyup to join a project thread or /requestadd to request to be added to a manually assigned project channel by following the instructions in the bot-commands channel.
 
Are you curious about what your colleagues think about a certain issue? Go to any relevant channel to your question and use the /poll command to conduct a simple poll.
 
Saw a project in SASS and want to alert your colleagues to it? You can use the /alert command in any of the channels and choose whether it was a longform task or a supplemental task, enter however much information you have about the project, and I'll automatically direct your message to the <#{{sassalert}}> or <#{{supplementalalert}}> channel depending on what kind of task it was.
 
And finally, if you have any suggestions about the Discord server, the issues you have in DTT that you'd like the Plint language managers to bring up during the meetings, a language or pool specific question or suggestion that you'd like to ask in your native language, or anything else, you can make suggestions or send inquiries using the /suggest command.
 
You can find all this information and more in the <#{{botcommands}}> channel.
 
Happy subtitling!

welcome.message:
Hello, subtitler! 
 
Welcome to the Plint DTT Discord server. I'm the server's bot, Sassy. ü§ñ
 
Right now, you only have access to one channel called `Reception`. This is a waiting room for newcomers where you can set up your server profile and wait until an admin gives you access to the rest of the server.
 
All you have to do to set up your user profile is to:
 
‚úÖ  Go back to the <#{{reception}}> channel by clicking on the channel name here.
‚úÖ  Type `/usersetup`.
‚úÖ  Press space and enter your name when prompted. If you use a different version of your name from what you have registered with Plint, you can include it in brackets (i.e. ‚ÄòJonathan (Jon) Smith‚Äô or ‚ÄòJonathan Smith (Jon)‚Äô ). But please make sure your username doesn‚Äôt exceed 32 characters.
‚úÖ  Press enter or tab and select your language from the list.
‚úÖ  Press enter.
 
If your language is not listed there, please select @new language and wait for an admin to contact you for more details.
 
After that, you can sit back and relax until an admin responds to your request. Once this happens, your nickname in the server is going to be automatically changed to the name you submitted. You will receive another message from me letting you know that you can now access the server, and I'm going to provide you with more information about how to use Discord and the server rules.
 
Happy subtitling!
welcome.title: Welcome!

messageMovedTo:
Hi, the following message you posted has been moved to <#{{channel}}>:
 
{{message}} {{attachment}}
messageCopiedTo:
Hi, the following message you posted has been copied to <#{{channel}}>:
 
{{message}} {{attachment}}
taggedBot: What is thy bidding, my master?
No, I wasn't translating, I swear!
Ph'nglui mglw'nafh Cthulhu R'lyeh wgah'nagl fhtagn.
Of all the gin joints in all the world, you walk into mine.
Make me an offer I can't refuse.
discordError: There has been an error. Blame Discord for this.
setParentError:
An error has occurred while setting parent categories. 
I assume you tried to create a thread inside a thread causing a 'threadception'; or entered a command that was meant to be used in a channel. Why would you even do that?
threadCreated: A new thread called <#{{thread}}> has been created upon <@{{user}}>'s request. If you're working on the same project, `/buddyup` now!
acceptThread: Do you accept to create or join to {{thread}}?
userPronounNotify: You will {{isAdd}} be called {{pronoun}} from now on.
enterProperName: The name you entered is somehow problematic.
